page.title: 09KEEPING A PONY.
page.content: In 1981 I bought a pony called Pam, I didn't ralise how much trouble and hard work I was in for. At first my dad got a nasty kick. We kept Pam at Middlethorpe Farm but she only stayed there one week because it was Â£5.50 a week not including a stable. Once when I was just going to mount Pam, a cat ran under her legs. She reared up and broke her saddle and snapped her reins I had to buy a new saddle and bridle. Then I went to Middle Warren Farm. One day I clipped the leading rope onto Pam's head collar but she wouldn't move even though I pulled and patted her. My dad phoned the vet and she had to get an x ray. I discovered that she had fractured her cannon (a leg bone) I kept her a bit longer and then sold her. BY NICOLA MINCHER AGE 11
